intro: Filago parvula, commonly known as the small filago, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring and summer months. Filago parvula is often found in low nutrient soils and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
